bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 108 (Wednesday, June 27, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. COLLINS of New York:H.R. 6241.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the United States Constitution[Page H5816]

item.title: Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

summary.text:
Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act

This bill prohibits companies that are headquartered in China, are connected to China's government, or have more than 25% of voting stock owned by China's citizens from qualifying as small business concerns that may receive assistance from the Small Business Administration.

bill.title: Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act

item.title: Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act
To prohibit certain business concerns from receiving assistance from the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes.
Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
